titles.title: Panama Canal Commission Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 1995
Panama Canal Commission Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 1995
To authorize expenditures for fiscal year 1995 for the operation and maintenance of the Panama Canal, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Executive Comment Requested from Panama Canal Commission.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Navigation.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Favorable Executive Comment Received from Panama Canal Commission.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-526.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 293.

action.text: Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 6/13/1994--Passed House amended. Panama Canal Commission Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 1995 - Authorizes the Panama Canal Commission, from the Panama Canal Revolving Fund, to make expenditures, contracts, and commitments for the operation, maintenance, and improvement of the Panama Canal for FY 1995. Amends the Panama Canal Act of 1979 to permit the use of Commission funds to defray the cost of education services provided by schools in the United States to: (1) Commission employees who are U.S. citizens; and (2) persons who were receiving such services at the expense of the Canal Zone Government. Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to expand the definition of "special immigrant" to include Panamanian immigrants who, as of the date the Panama Canal Treaty of 1977 entered into force, have been employed by the U.S. Government in the Canal Zone with a total of 15 years of service or more and continue to be so employed. (Current law confers such status only on those individuals who are honorably retired.)
